bow: my plan worked she eating more vegetables my year old has been going on veggie strike for while now ve been trying everything could think of and nothing was working was getting worried about when be able to convince her to eat them again and how to keep her healthy until then but it hit me yesterday she loves smoothies had so many recipes saved on pinterest of smoothies that had veggies in them too so tried it this morning berry kale smoothie she loves it the sun came out today and feel hopeful again of course it not an original thought and ll still continue to encourage her to eat them in non deceptive ways but for now this is win any moms have recipes of smoothies or secret veggie foods for themselves or their kids that would be good to try when was doing keto before got pregnant made this vanilla pound cake with cauliflower and stevia theres like cups of cauliflower in the recipe put little bit of melted butter on it and my toddler ate it up dont have the recipe saved anymore but you should find it if you search pinterest for keto cauliflower vanilla pound cake sounds good thank you zucchini is great vegetable to shred inside of things ve made meatballs mac and cheese spaghetti etc with zucchini hidden inside of it used to make spinach banana pancakes for my little one they were green but the banana taste was strong so she did care she now loves spinach also banana bread muffins with zucchini carrots is something pretty much all kids love that good idea zuchinni is pretty neutral in taste the meatballs sound good ve got some bananas in the freezer ll probably try the bread idea soon thanks so when was kid refused to eat veggies and my mom started having crunch competition with me and my sister where you would chew carrots cucumbers and the like and try to get the loudest crunch that worked on me took many years before realised her intent sweet potato or squash too you can add it to mac amp cheese and you do even taste it with my year old veggies have to be mixed in with something else he won eat them by themselves but if you put veggies in fried rice or quesadillas scrambled eggs or chili for example he loves it doesn even realize he eating them lol no problem hope your little one loves it omg this is genius my son is only 7mos but almost excited to try this with him pumpkin muffins did something like this to my husband he pitched fit about hating the way brussels sprouts smell when roasted and declared that he would never eat them so cooked cup of ground sprouts down into spaghetti sauce and didn tell him until later put spinach in smoothies my year old even knows it spinach as he helps pack all the stuff into the blender and always asks for the spinach he wo eat veggies much either but smoothies he drinks right down similarly ve seen brownie recipes with black beans and zucchini my mom used to purée carrots and put it in our mac and cheese couldn tell the difference there are also lots of pasta rice now made of veggies every little bit helps throw baby food pouch of pureed butternut squash in my kids mac and cheese every time and they do notice it just makes it saucier that hilarious like the idea of turning it into game that lot of awesome ideas perfect season to try them out too definitely need to utilize the cauliflower rice tots and all more only have pro tip and it that blueberries will hide the color of anything so they are great for making smoothie look appetizing which sure you ve picked up on with the first smoothie you made picky eaters may balk at green or other odd colored smoothie that comes from blending various fruits and veggies but they will typically eat purple one yep muffins work great too made black bean brownies and my kid devoured them they re as tasty as regular brownies ooh yes purée carrots and celery for chicken noodle soup the abc pasta is fun for my 4yo —he more likely to eat that than any other type of noodle in soup because we can play what letter do you have and then we eat the letters my mom would do this with fruit except it was about beating the clock she also do water chugging contests with us does she like spaghetti you can make vegetarian bolognese sauce with carrots zucchini eggplant all kinds of veggies and it just tastes like spaghetti to little one the smoothie do the most for my girl is banana frozen blueberries ground chia kale peanut butter unsweetened chocolate almond milk full fat coconut milk my little guy is big fan of soup make this black bean soup it has basically any veggies you have laying around the house in it bell peppers carrots an onion dont add celery because find the taste kinda over powering chicken stalk can of black beans then season it with the same spices you would make tacos out of cumin chillie powder etc the key is to puree the soup so its smooth then add handful of shredded cheese on top you can also do dollop of sour cream and crunched up taco chips chopped spinach in stews and chili lentils in chili various random stuff cut up really small in meatloaf broccoli has very strong taste and is almost possible to hide but spinach zucchini peppers tomato carrot onion those all hide pretty easily my toddler thinks that all smoothies are green muahaha we made waffles the other day in bowl that saved our leftover mashed sweet potatoes in that was good have you roasted broccoli to crisp ve had to say you can have more broccoli as soon as you finish your pizza not hidden though but the little florets are more fun to chew than lot of normal veggies today made zucchini and carrot muffins you could super finely shred them and she would have no clue veggies are in there https beslimmer beyou com zucchini carrot oatmeal muffins this was the recipe used that actually sounds delicious my kids eat frozen veggies straight from the freezer to cup and they eat them like popcorn lol my friend just tried it friday and her daughter who eats no veggies loved it so true plus blueberries are so good for you lol used to have the opposite issue love the way brussels sprouts smell when being roasted or sautéed but hated the taste basically forced myself to like them and now they re my favorite vegetable same with my year old she loves soup too so many veggies you can throw in soup that she normally wouldn eat on their own that sounds yummy and packed full of good stuff this post is worth saving for all parents am so trying this that is brilliant game to try did like many veggies until learned how to cook them to be tasty roasted with seasonings and parmesan cheese is the way to go on many cheese sauce helps things like asparagus and broccoli just keep having it present without pressure to just try it put it on her plate alongside things she likes and be ok with her not eating it as long as she getting nutrients elsewhere it can take many presentations for kids to try food when was little kid would eat broccoli only if it was steamed and had cheese sauce on it but if those parameters were met would eat about half ton of broccoli my 4yo why even eat his smoothie without the spinach because it tastes different ha ha he really tough cookie with the veggies so many things he used to eat he just wo anymore removed put tons of butter on the veggies and cook them then give veggies as first course so they ll be the most hungry don do this but it would totally work tried variation of this and it went ok it wasn as good as regular mac cheese but it couldn be done with different veggies also try to add peas or corn or things like that to regular pasta or other dishes he seems to be more willing to eat them if they have sauce like the rest of the dish https raiasrecipes com 2015 04 easy one pot mac cheese with hidden veggies html we do banana strawberry spinach cooked sweet potato greek yogurt ground flax seed ground chia seed milk and honey smoothie no measuring or anything just use the quantities that you want the banana and strawberry are so strong you do taste anything else also make big batch and do popsicle out of it that way the kids feel like it even more of treat sympathize my son next week will gag on any vegetable and spit it out it phase sure but the smoothie and popsicle at least make me sleep easier at night haha can say this didn work for us my mom cooks everything with butter or lard and my 4yo still won touch it she now refuses to eat any kind of noodles because someone said veggie noodles out loud at the store ve tried offering just veggies with the promise of different food to follow but she will wait it out amp just go without completely if veggie makes it in her mouth she dry heaves she going on month of no candies or sweets because she has yet to try veggie in almost year she ate them fine until after she turned smoothies are all can get her to consume veggie wise cheese on veggies is complete no go you just made her livid because you have completely ruined amp contaminated her cheese like to be clear that developed arfid after my mom started sneaking things into my food at developed scurvy because refused to eat single thing she gave me ever as single mother after figured out she was sneaking things did lose two teeth as result and my adult teeth never grew in in those spots have weird jaw misalignment my 4yo son loves the veggie rotini noodles when do spaghetti use those instead of regular noodles and sometimes cook them by themselves with just some fake butter dairy allergy and garlic salt he loves them in anything ve always hid veggies in our regular adult food too as it just great way to lighten any recipe here are some of my ideas lasagna with chopped broccoli amp chopped spinach you can find this frozen in walmart and mixed into the meat meatloaf cupcakes meatloaf baked in cupcake pans with cubed carrot cubed butternut squash or shredded zuchinni mashed potato parsnip or potato cauliflower sweet potato butternut squash sweet potato carrot add plenty of butter milk salt and pepper little cinnamon is great in the sweet potato types baked potato soup chicken broth russet potato carrot parsnip squash cauliflower cheddar cheese greek yogurt sour cream blend with immersion blender serve with baked potato toppings yuo can do this one in the instantpot if you want add basically any blended veggie into red pasta sauce anything that can dip gets eaten here any dip it the act of dipping that matters yeah smoothies or those packets are the only way my kids eat veggies my year old loves kale banana pineapple coconut water my yr old will drink almost any smoothie but loves pb amp banana almond or peanut butter strawberry and any kind of milk pasta sauce is an easy way to hide veggies too smoothies can be frozen into popsicles fell for the water chugging contest trick up until was 13 finally realized what was up and tried to chug wine cooler while they were chugging water 10 would not recommend we make zucchini pancakes with the protein pancake mix and freeze them for later microwave 20 seconds they are good for while my absolute favorite smoothie is blueberry kefir with spinach and english cucumber you can throw some actual blueberries in there too if you want it more purple and less green steamed carrots peaches strawberries there are two books that got me started in before hiding it was for child but my husband when it started by gradually increasing the size of the vegetables he learned to love them he knew was doing it but did want to know what vegetable or in what dish and he usually could tell still use the recipes and the general principles deceptively delicious by jessica seinfeld and the sneaky chef by missy chase lapine black bean brownies are awesome here the recipe use https chocolatecoveredkatie com 2012 09 06 no flour black bean brownies shredded carrot works pretty well too although they do disappear completely pumpkin carrot butternut squash hide veggies in rice grated carrots with peas corn and chopped green beans or diced sweet mini bell peppers also put them in pasta my year old will sometimes pick things out of the pasta as much as he can though depending on his mood also chop spinach in the food processor and mix it with ricotta in baked ziti both my kids really love that one give her some choices it works like treat with my girls ll say do you want or and they ll pick the one they want the most and eat it it super helpful about the abc pasta have stupid question how do you cook it do you cook it like pasta and then throw it in the soup you can put lots of veggies in spaghetti sauce we got over the surprise of green food by calling it frog whatever he eats it up if it vibrant green frog muffin with like two pounds of spinach in if hah definitely try this my kid wo wat green things except dried sea weed we called it green chocolate thanks for sharing have added carrots to spaghetti sauce cook the carrots and then blend it yummm chop tons of veggies really small saute them add tomato sauce and put it on pasta my kid does even notice them make muffins with puréed spinach in them call them hulk smash muffins or pj masks green gecko muffins or whatever cartoon character my kids like who has green theme there few spinach muffin recipes floating around they will be gorgeous vibrant green color yep just throw it in and wait til it cooks it usually fast and it fine to leave it in bit longer and let it simmer and not stupid at all pasta confuses me always cook way much or way too little my kids had hard time getting enough protein but they loved french toast so started making it without milk just egg and whole wheat bread and some cinnamon nutmeg whatever once slice of bread sucks up about one egg so if got them to eat slice of french toast then taa daa protein that cute idea ve had this problem with my kid gave up and am now taking her to food therapy once week most speech therapists also do food therapy offering raw veggies with dip my daughter is iffy on some veggies but will eat them in vegetable soup though 🤷🏻‍♀️ would totally try this if the sound of crunching didn make me feel deep rage lol if she will eat spaghetti sauce make your own add zucchini spinach carrots peppers etc to mine with the crushed tomatoes and blend it up lots of hidden veggies to go with pasta ll ask at her next checkup about this thank you https www allrecipes com recipe 222708 green monster smoothie you should try this one if she not allergic to nuts it tastes like peanut butter and banana happening great idea my son will love this game that fantastic check out kids eat in color on instagram or facebook she dietitian and she shares lot of great info on food and how to help with picky eaters shared her with my sil who was having issues with her year old not eating vegetables and since using the tips there her daughter is now eating things she wouldn touch before do mac and cheese but the sauce is basically carrot purée my year old is basically on food strike she only wants to drink milk she will go for few days at time and only eat one solid food such as olives or cucumber slices the peel she is still breastfeeding to go down for nap or go to sleep at night but not very much am getting really worried that she is going to be malnourished have tried all the tricks smoothies kid versions of foods making foods into things like cats or faces etc playing games like trading bites etc she just does not want to eat the only thing she will reliably ask for is milk and food bars which are supposed to be just for when we are out has anyone had success getting very stubborn toddler to eat anything love doing choices for everything with her she usually really good about it for some reason the veggies will magically have third option she makes up no but she getting better with it love the idea of sweet potato would have ever thought of it but thinking now it does sound really good yum ll have to try that that such good idea oh yum she loves pj masks super excited to see if she ll eat gecko muffins now use avocado to make extra creamy mac and cheese ve also blended cauliflower and added that to mac and cheese look up the book deceptively delicious by jessica seinfeld there were so many ideas my elderly neighbor suggested it because her husband is very picky eater and was getting worse as he gets older all my best ideas came from old people instead of mashed potato make mashed root veggies and sweet potato especially parsley get sweet when heated have frozen finely chopped veggies and corn to put into meat sauce and other stews or minched meat just chop it to shreds in food processor or the blender ve started baking muffins every sunday night after the kids are in bed find lots of fairly healthy muffin recipes with hidden veggies and my kids gobble those things up like candy this week we have pumpkin muffins with chocolate chips the chips are sweetened with stevia and the ingredients are basically bananas milk butter pumpkin honey flour we use gluten free because we re celiac their most preferred muffins are the chocolate chocolate chip muffins which are really 70 zucchini we also make hulk muffins which use an entire blender full of spinach and they think its food colouring it makes breakfast time through the week really quick and easy chocolate zucchini bread https www twopeasandtheirpod com chocolate zucchini bread you really ca taste it and it actually adds creaminess to the smoothie so ive got soapbox about kids smoothies keep reading that strawberries have more pesticides than any other fruit my kids love smoothies we eat so many strawberries so decided to grow my own strawberries omg they took over my yard if your kids like smoothies do plant strawberries in the yard put them in big pot bought my kid pack of shopkins stickers while back or maybe it came with coloring book bunch of the stickers were fruit and vegetables with little shopkins faces somehow my kid decided to make recipe for her special smoothie and put the stickers on the kitchen counter and then asked me to make her recipe was shocked to see broccoli carrot and peas added to berries and banana but just said okay and made it for her even snuck in little protein powder added almond milk ice and sweetener and she inhaled it that was probably year ago and honestly the stickers are still there and we still make it pretty frequently after her smoothie success she put some other stickers there too but those were fancy desserts and cakes so just never acknowledged them she thought she could trick me heads up lots of baby food pouches are filled with added sugars and preservatives it usually better to get fresh
